revised_title: Surface Decomposition of Silver Cyanamide Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the slow decomposition of thin crystals of silver cyanamide using electron microscopy and diffraction. They found that the decomposition is a surface reaction, with silver and an amorphous material (possibly carbon or cyanogen) as the solid decomposition products. The decomposition rate slows down after an average depth of about 20 Å has decomposed. The silver is highly mobile on the crystal surface and can aggregate at isolated points, showing epitaxy under certain conditions.
